list_definition.definition: (often with to, on etc) to fasten with a string, rope etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He tied the horse to a tree
The parcel was tied with string
I don’t like this job – I hate being tied to a desk.

list_definition.definition: to fasten by knotting; to make a knot in
to be joined by a knot etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The belt of this dress ties at the front.

list_definition.definition: to score the same number of points etc (in a game, competition etc)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Three people tied for first place.

list_definition.definition: a strip of material worn tied round the neck under the collar of a shirt

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He wore a shirt and tie.

list_definition.definition: an equal score or result (in a game, competition etc); a draw

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The game ended in a tie.

list_definition.definition: a game or match to be played

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Their fourth round tie is due to be played next Wednesday.
